result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:07 PM (64-06) Defendant Isaac D Goines appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Isaac D Goines.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Deputy Jarett McArdle, Walworth County.
Jarett McArdle duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Crawford.
Witness identified the defendant in court on the video.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
2:12PM - Cross examination by Attorney Hilton.
2:13PM - Argument by the State. Requesting bind over.
2:14PM - Argument by Attorney Hilton.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
Arraignment held in open Court.
Attorney Hilton acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaac D Goines appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Isaac D Goines.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing rights given, hearing requested within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Petition for waiver of fees and costs

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac D Goines in court, in custody by video. Attorney Jason Daane appeared. Minutes filed.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney JJ Crawford appeared for the State. Defendant Isaac D Goines in court in custody, via video. Attorney Joshua Ryan appeared for Isaac Goines. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Bail information total bond to cover all cases. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF827, 22CF330, 22CT239 & 20CF72

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-3676 thru 3679
